results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christina Brim’s mum died recently and a lot of memories and stories have been going around in my head. Brims pays tribute to her mother, the glue that kept her ‘large mob’ together and cohesive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Grandfather TL
results.creator_credit: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Nan
results.creator_credit: Teialah Mason, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Elsie Jones was a respected Aboriginal elder and a lovely woman, the kind of lady you never forget. She died when Teialah Mason was six but has left an indelible impression on her and has inspired in Mason pride in her heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Teialah Mason, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My nan
results.creator_credit: Tammy-Lee Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘A nan, a mum, an auntie, a cousin and a friend’. Tammy-Lee remembers her beloved nan, without whom there would’ve been no family.

results.brief_description: A social commentary on the environment in the year 3000 with a look back into the past and what used to be before the thoughtless destruction by humanity of the earth’s forests. 3-D computer animation with music soundtrack - no commentary.

results.title: Morehu
results.brief_description: Rita Morrison’s mother died three days after the 9/11 terrorist attacks. Her grief would link these two events forever. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie heritage Trust.

results.title: My wardrobe door
results.brief_description: Nadia Rose’s wardrobe door is full of photo’s of her friends and family. It keeps them close to her even when she is far away. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie heritage Trust.

results.title: The old man
results.creator_credit: Koorie Heritage Trust and Lee Stewart
results.brief_description: Lee Stewart pays tribute to his father who coached the local football team and was an inspiration to his sons and his players. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie Heritage Trust.
